item.title: 543 Diameter of Binary Tree
item.description: LC 543 Diameter of Binary Tree Given a binary tree, you need to compute the length of the diameter of the tree. The diameter of a binary tree is the length of the longest path between any two nodes in a tree. This path may or may not pass through the root. Example: Given a binary tree 1 / \ 2 3 / \ 4 5 Return 3, which is the length of the path [4,2,1,3] or [5,2,1,3].
